structural_analysis.coordinate_system module

Classes:

CoordinateSystem

class structural_analysis.coordinate_system.CoordinateSystem(i_vector: structural_analysis.vector.Vector, twist_angle: float, origin_vector: structural_analysis.vector.Vector)

Bases: object

A class to represent a cartesian coordinate system. …

_istructural_analysis.Vector

the i component of the coordinate system basis

_jstructural_analysis.Vector

the j component of the coordinate system basis

_kstructural_analysis.Vector

the k component of the coordinate system basis

basisnumpy.ndarray

a 3x3 numpy array holding the basis vectors [i, j, k]

originstructural_analysis.Vector

the position vector of the origin of the coordinate system

_global_i_vector:

the i base vector described in a global coordinate system

_global_twist_angle:

the rotation angle of the coordinate_system around the i base vector

_get_rotation_matrix_around_vector(angle: float, rotation_axis: Vector) -> np.ndarray:

static method, returns a 3x3 rotation matrix around the passed rotation axis vector with angle

get_coord_transformation_matrix(self, coordinate_system: CoordinateSystem) -> np.ndarray:

returns a 3x3 transformation matrix from the calling coordinate system to passed coordinate system instance

get_coord_transformation_matrix(coordinate_system: structural_analysis.coordinate_system.CoordinateSystem) → numpy.ndarray

returns a 3x3 transformation matrix from the calling coordinate system to passed coordinate system instance

Keyword arguments:

coordinate_system – coordinate system which objects will transform to.

structural_analysis.material module

Classes:

Material Steel Concrete

Material is an abstract class. Other classes are derived from Material class.

class structural_analysis.material.Concrete(elasticity_modulus, poissons_ratio, yield_strength=None, characteristic_strength=None)

Bases: structural_analysis.material.Material

A class to represent concrete material instance assigned to an element. …

elasticity_modulusfloat

Modulus of elasticity concrete usually around 20 GPa

poissons_ratiofloat

Poisson’s ratio of concrete usually around 0.2

yield_strengthfloat

Yield strength of concrete at 0.2% offset in stress-strain diagram.

characteristic_strengthfloat

characteristic strength of concrete.

property shear_modulus

shear modulus of concrete

stress(strain)

describes the constitutive relationship. returns stress value on a given strain.

class structural_analysis.material.Material(elasticity_modulus, poissons_ratio)

Bases: object

An abstract class to represent material instance assigned to an element. …

elasticity_modulusfloat

Modulus of elasticity of the material

poissons_ratiofloat

Poisson’s ratio of the material

stress(self, strain):

abstract method, implemented by derived classes. describes the constitutive relationship. returns stress value on a given strain.

abstract property shear_modulus

abstract method, implemented by derived classes. Represents shear modulus of material.

abstract stress(strain)

abstract method, implemented by derived classes. describes the constitutive relationship. returns stress value on a given strain.

class structural_analysis.material.Steel(elasticity_modulus, poissons_ratio, yield_strength=None, ultimate_strength=None)

Bases: structural_analysis.material.Material

A class to represent steel material instance assigned to an element. …

elasticity_modulusfloat

Modulus of elasticity of steel usually around 200 GPa

poissons_ratiofloat

Poisson’s ratio of steel usually around 0.3

yield_strengthfloat

Yield strength of steel

ultimate_strengthfloat

ultimate strength of steel

property shear_modulus

shear modulus of steel usually around 79.3 GPa

stress(strain)

describes the constitutive relationship. returns stress value on a given strain.

structural_analysis.node module

Classes:

Node

class structural_analysis.node.Node(x, y, z)

Bases: object

A class to represent a node. …

xfloat

x coordinate of the node in the structure coordinate system

yfloat

y coordinate of the node in the structure coordinate system

zfloat

z coordinate of the node in the structure coordinate system

_structureStructure

structure instance containing the node

position_vectorVector

position vector instance holding x, y, and z coordinates of the node instance

dof_x_DegreeOfFreedom

translational degree of freedom instance in the x-axis direction of the structure coordinate system

dof_y_DegreeOfFreedom

translational degree of freedom instance in the y-axis direction of the structure coordinate system

dof_z_DegreeOfFreedom

translational degree of freedom instance in the z-axis direction of the structure coordinate system

dof_rx_DegreeOfFreedom

rotational degree of freedom instance around the x-axis of the structure coordinate system

dof_ry_DegreeOfFreedom

rotational degree of freedom instance around the y-axis of the structure coordinate system

dof_rz_DegreeOfFreedom

rotational degree of freedom instance around the z-axis of the structure coordinate system

property degrees_of_freedom: list[structural_analysis._degree_of_freedom._DegreeOfFreedom]

returns a list holding the six degrees of freedom instances of the node

property structure: Structure

structure containing the node instance

structural_analysis.section module

Classes:

Section Circle Rectangle ArbitrarySection

Section class is an abstract class. Other classes are derived from Section.

class structural_analysis.section.ArbitrarySection(area, inertia_y, inertia_z, polar_inertia, warping_rigidity=None)

Bases: structural_analysis.section.Section

A class to represent an arbitrary shaped section with user-defined geometric properties which will be assigned to element objects. …

property area

area of the cross-section

property inertia_y

inertia of the cross-section around the element y-axis

property inertia_z

inertia of the cross-section around the element z-axis

property polar_inertia

inertia of the cross-section around the element x-axis

property warping_rigidity

warping rigidity of the cross-section

class structural_analysis.section.Circle(radius)

Bases: structural_analysis.section.Section

A class to represent a circular section which will be assigned to element objects. …

property area

area of the cross-section

property inertia_y

inertia of the cross-section around the element y-axis

property inertia_z

inertia of the cross-section around the element z-axis

property polar_inertia

inertia of the cross-section around the element x-axis

property warping_rigidity

zero for circular cross-sections

structural_analysis.structure module

Classes:

Structure

class structural_analysis.structure.Structure(elements: list[structural_analysis.FrameElements.element.Element])

Bases: object

A class to represent a structure of elements. …

elementslist[Element]

list of element instances in the structure

nodeslist[Node]

list of node instances in the structure

degrees_of_freedomlist[_DegreeOfFreedom]

list of structure degrees of freedom

free_degrees_of_freedomlist[_DegreeOfFreedom]

list of all unrestrained degrees of freedom instances in the structure

restrained_degrees_of_freedomlist[_DegreeOfFreedom]

list of all restrained degrees of freedom instances in the structure

coordinate_systemCoordinateSystem

global coordinate system in which the structure is defined.

_get_nodes_and_dofs(self) -> tuple[[Node], [_DegreeOfFreedom]]

returns a tuple of all nodes and degrees of freedom in structure.

_get_free_and_restrained_dofs(self):

returns a tuple of all free and restrained degrees of freedom in structure.

_assign_structure_to_nodes(self):

assigns structure instance to node structure attribute

_assign_structure_to_elements(self):

assigns structure instance to element structure attribute

structural_analysis.vector module

Classes:

Vector

class structural_analysis.vector.Vector(array: list[float])

Bases: numpy.ndarray

A class to represent a vector. …

arraylist[float]

list of size 3 holding i, j, k values of the vector instance

_coordinate_systemCoordinateSystem

coordinate system used to describe vector components (i, j, k)

transform_vector(coordinate_system: CoordinateSystem):

returns a new transformed vector instance in the new coordinate system

magnitude:

returns the magnitude of the vector

normalized:

returns a new normalized vector instance

project_vector_on_vector(vector: Vector):

returns a new vector instance projected on the passed vector instance

project_vector_on_vector_scaler(vector: Vector):

returns a signed magnitude of vector projected on the passed vector instance

project_vector_on_plane(vector: Vector):

returns a new vector instance projected on a plane having the passed normal vector instance

property coordinate_system: CoordinateSystem

coordinate system used to describe vector components (i, j, k)

property magnitude: float

returns the magnitude of the vector.

property normalized: structural_analysis.vector.Vector

returns a new normalized vector instance.

project_vector_on_plane(plane_normal: structural_analysis.vector.Vector) → structural_analysis.vector.Vector

returns a new vector instance projected on a plane having the passed normal vector instance

Keyword arguments:

plane_normal – a vector normal to plane.

project_vector_on_vector(vector: structural_analysis.vector.Vector) → structural_analysis.vector.Vector

returns a new vector instance projected on the passed vector instance Keyword arguments:

vector – a vector instance to project on.

project_vector_on_vector_scaler(vector_2: structural_analysis.vector.Vector)

returns a signed magnitude of vector projected on the passed vector instance Keyword arguments:

vector – a vector instance to project on.

transform_vector(coordinate_system: CoordinateSystem) → Vector

returns a new transformed vector instance in the new coordinate system.

Keyword arguments: coordinate_system – the coordinate system which the vector transforms to.
